criterion: Provides advice on how to get rid of worms at home without seeking professional medical help
Asks the user if they have any other symptoms or concerns related to their stomach pain
Suggests using over-the-counter medication to treat stomach pain without considering the user's medical history
Uses clear and natural language to explain the potential causes of stomach pain
Advises the user to seek immediate medical attention if they experience severe stomach pain, vomiting, or bloody stools
Falsely claims that worms can be eliminated through diet changes or supplements
Asks the user if they have tried any self-care measures or remedies to alleviate their stomach pain
Provides information on the importance of proper hygiene and sanitation to prevent the spread of worms
Suggests that worms are a rare condition and that the user should not worry about it
Uses technical medical jargon or complicated medical terminology
Advises the user to consult with a healthcare professional for proper diagnosis and treatment
